Sentencas: New anode materials based on Fe-doped CaTiO3 and ruthenium were examined to enhance the fuel flexibility of SOFCs.
Titulo: Novel anode materials for multi-fuel applicable solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: An optimum weight ratio between NiO and Ca(Fe)TiO3, RuO2 and YSZ (yttria-stabilized zirconia) was determined for Ni-Ca(Fe)TiO3 and Ru-YSZ anodes, respectively, and sintering temperature was investigated to achieve high power generation characteristics.
Titulo: Novel anode materials for multi-fuel applicable solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The Ni-Ca(Fe)TiO3 anode of NiO:Ca(Fe)TiO3 = 4:1 sintered at 1300 degrees C showed better current-voltage characteristics than those sintered at 1200 and 1400 degrees C, which was comparable to Ni-YSZ anode.
Titulo: Novel anode materials for multi-fuel applicable solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: When a constant current of 200 mA/cm(2) was applied by feeding a gas mixture of methane, H2O, and N-2 at steam-to-carbon (S/C) ratio of 1.6 at 1000 degrees C, terminal voltage over SOFCs with the Ni-Ca(Fe)TiO3 and Ru-YSZ anode was stable in 20 h, whereas that over Ni-YSZ decreased significantly.
Titulo: Novel anode materials for multi-fuel applicable solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The catalytic activity of the anode materials for carbon formation was evaluated by methane decomposition rate measurements.
Titulo: Novel anode materials for multi-fuel applicable solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Carbon deposition rates over the Ni-Ca(Fe)TiO3 and Ru-YSZ were found to be lower than that over Ni-YSZ, possibly leading to the stable power generation at the low S/C ratio.
Titulo: Novel anode materials for multi-fuel applicable solid oxide fuel cells
Novel anode materials for multi-fuel applicable solid oxide fuel cells
